result.execSummary:
The defendant Cornelius D. Britt was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Cornelius D. Britt is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Cornelius D. Britt was found guilty of 2nd Deg. Sex. Assault/Unconscious Victim, a class C felony, Wisconsin Statutes 940.225(2)(d).
  • Cornelius D. Britt was found guilty of Burglary-Dwelling, Boat or Motor Home, a class E felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.10(2)(e).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

superMiscConds.notes: If probation or extended supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for the balance due.  Collections may include income assignment.  This applies to all counts and financial obligations.

Obey all of the rules and regulations of supervising probation agent.  Pay supervision fees.  Do not possess or consume alcoholic beverages and do not have alcoholic beverages within the residence.  Do not possess or consume controlled substances, except by prescription.  Submit voluntarily to random tests of blood, breath or urine.  Participate in counseling deemed appropriate by your agent, which may include: alcohol/drug, anger management/DV counseling, psychiatric/psychological, AODA Assessment and follow-through with recommended treatment.  Counseling shall specifically include:  Psychiatric/ psych assessment.
*   Pay fine of $400 and court costs including all applicable surcharges.
*   Submit to a DNA sample and pay surcharge.
*   Pay restitution in the sum of $760 plus surcharges.
May not have contact with COR (dob 3/23/83), CEP (dob 6/2/04), unless otherwise permitted by the court/agent.  May not possess any weapons, including firearms.

records.addlTxt: Dated August 27, 2019 - IT IS ORDERED that the motion to extend the time for filing a notice of intent to pursue postconviction relief is denied.

Dated August 8, 2019 - IT IS ORDERED that within thirty days of the date of this order, the State shall advise whether it objects to extending the time for Britt to file a notice of intent to pursue postconviction relief from the September 2015 judgment of conviction.  Any objection shall be supported by grounds.
Notice sent to State Public Defender's Office 07/18/19

records.addlTxt: Atty  H Edwards.

Attorney Tracey Braun appeared for the State. Atty Hilary Edwards on behalf of Atty Lassiter. No appearance by phone by DE.   Clerk P. Scypta.   
MINUTES:  1043 -   Victim rights compliance.  DE is out of state in another DOC facility and is unavailable for an appearance today. ADA Braun believes the JOC may be inaccurate, according to her records. Atty Edwards has records from Atty Lassiter's notes to confirm. Only Ct2 is in question. Court reporter reviews transcript this day.  Upon review of the transript, the sentence for Ct2 should be 4 yrs initial confinement, 4 yrs extended supervision - CONCURRENT to Ct1. JOC is ordered to be amended forthwith.

Court attempted to contact the DE in prison for phone appearance at 11:06am - Institution stated call was scheduled from 9:50am to 10:45am.  Hearing is rescheduled to 1/6/2016 at 10am.  Clerk to arrange for phone appearance.
With Marew White/Dodge Correctional Institution a phone appearance is arranged for the deft for the hearing on 11/9/15 at 10am.
Hearing at 11-09-2015 10:00 am

records.descr: Notice and acknowledge of def voting ineligibility

records.addlTxt:
Attorney Tracey Braun appeared for the State.  Defendant in custody and appeared in court w/ Attorney Carmen Lassiter.  Clerk: MHerr.
MINUTES:  9:06am-  Matter heard with 14CF1157.  Victim rights compliance - victim is present with Spanish interpreter, Leo Martin.  
Count 1 - Defendant sentenced to WSP for 17 years: 9 years initial confinement & 8 years extended supervision w/ conditions.  
Count 2 - Defendant sentenced to WSP for 17 years: 9 years initial confinement & 8 years extended supervision w/ conditions - concurrent to count 1. 
Cost of $400 plus DNA surcharge. Credit for 412 days.  DE only stipulates to $760.00 of the restitution request.  Victim agrees to amount for reasons set forth on the record.  Court orders restitution in the amount of $760.00.  DE to submit DNA sample (unless previously done).  DE is not eligible for CIP or SAP.  Appeal rights given.

Attorney Jason Zapf appeared for the State.  Defendant appeared by Attorney Carmen Lassiter.  Clerk: MHerr.
MINUTES:  10:37am-  DE was not brought over for today's hearing.  Matter heard with 14CF1157.  Victim rights compliance - victim is present.  Attorney Lassiter is requesting an adjournment as she has not had time to review the PSI w/ the DE.  Court finds the PSI was not filed in a timely manner & grants request.  Sentencing hearing adjourned to September 1, 2015 at 08:30 am.  Bond continued.
Acknowledgment of Plea Offer/Agreement

Attorney Jason Zapf appeared for the State.  Defendant in custody and appeared in court w/ Attorney Carmen Lassiter.  Clerk: MHerr.
MINUTES:  9:55am-  Matter heard with 14CF1157 & 14CM878.  Victim rights compliance - victim is present.  Matter is resolved.  Defendant entered a plea of no contest to counts 1 & 2; found guilty by the court.  On the motion of the State, counts 3-6 are dismissed.  Presentence Investigation ordered.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for August 5, 2015 at 10:00 am.  Bond continued.
Amended - and demand for discovery - filed byADA J Zapf.

Attorney Jason Zapf appeared for the State.  Defendant appeared by Attorney Carmen Lassiter.  Clerk: MHerr.
MINUTES: 11:33am-  Matter heard with 14CF1157 & 14CM878.  DE was not brought over for today's hearing.  Attorney Lassiter states an offer was not received from the State until today.  Discussion held.  Matter will remain on the court's trial calendar for 6/22/2015.  Bond continued.
filed by ADA Jason Zapf
Demand for Discovery filed by ADA Robert Zapf
Of intent to use defendant's statement - filed by ADA J Zapf.

Attorney Jason Zapf appeared for the State.  Defendant in custody and appeared in court w/ Attorney Hilary Edwards for Attorney Carmen Lassiter.  Clerk: MHerr.
MINUTES:  10:43am-  Matter heard with 14CF1157 & 14CM878.  Victim rights compliance - alleged victim is present with Spanish interpreter, Leo Martin.  Interpreter sworn-in.  DNA results have been received.  Attorney Edwards is requesting an adjournment to allow Attorney Lassiter time to discuss the case w/ the State.  State is requesting an extension to file witness list & motion in limine.  DE does not object.  Court orders State to file by 4/29/2015.  Status conference scheduled for June 12, 2015 at 10:30 am.  Bond continued.

Special Prosecutor Attorney Jerrold Hinshaw appeared for the State.  Defendant in custody and appeared in court w/ Attorney Carmen Lassiter.  Clerk: MHerr.
MINUTES:  2:49pm-  Matter heard with 14CF1157 & 14CM878.  Victim rights compliance.  DE submitted DNA sample & sample was sent to the crime lab for testing on 12/23/2014.  Parties jointly request an adjournment to see if the DNA results are returned.  On the court's own motion, matter set for trial.  Court orders all witness lists & motions in limine be filed by 4/24/2015.  Final pre-trial scheduled for April 29, 2015 at 09:00 am.  Jury trial scheduled for June 22, 2015 at 09:00 am.  Bond continued.
**Victim did appear - does not speak English.  DA's office to request interpreter for future hearings.

Attorney Jason Zapf appeared for the State.  Defendant in custody and appeared in court w/ Attorney Carmen Lassiter.  Clerk: MHerr.
MINUTES:  2:23pm-  Matter heard with 14CF1157 & 14CM878.  Victim rights compliance - alleged victim C.O.R. was present but left the courtroom prior to going on the record.  DE voluntarily agrees to submit DNA at the request of the State.  Order does not need to be signed by the Court.  Status conference scheduled for January 21, 2015 at 03:00 pm to determine the status of the DNA testing.  Bond continued.

Attorney Jason Zapf appeared for the State.  Defendant in custody and appeared in court w/ Attorney Carmen Lassiter.  Clerk: MHerr.
MINUTES:  9:38am-  Matter heard w/ 14CF1157 & 14CM878.  Victim rights compliance.  State has filed a motion to compel DNA.  DE states he will voluntarily submit DNA.  Court adjourns matter to December 8, 2014 at 02:00 pm.  Bond continued.
in Support of Motion to Compel the Defendant to Submit to DNA Testing
to Compel the Defendant to Submit to DNA Testing - filed by ADA Jason Zapf

ADA Jason Zapf appeared for the State.  Defendant in custody and appeared in court w/ Attorney Carmen Lassiter.  Clerk: MHerr.
MINUTES:  9:21am-  Matter heard with 14CM878.  Victim rights compliance.  Attorney Lassiter is requesting an adjournment as she is waiting for statements from her investigator.  Court grants request.  Final pre-trial adjourned to November 14, 2014 at 09:00 am.  Bond continued.
Final pre-trial on September 30, 2014 at 09:00 am.
